definition:
Let $G$ be a finite abelian group and let $p\in {\mathbb{N}}$ be a
prime. The *$p$-primary component* of $G$, $\Pi_p$, is the subgroup of
all elements whose order is a power of $p$.

Note: The $p$-primary component of an abelian group $G$ coincides with
the unique Sylow $p$-subgroup of $G$.
